headline: Polymarket, Kalshi Gamify Truth With Bets on Politics, News
summary: Mention markets are the high-octane, fast-twitch speed competitions of the prediction market world. But they're just one corner of it. Users of Kalshi and its primary rival, Polymarket, can bet on events major and minor, from politics to sports to culture to the weather. Recent markets on Kalshi have included whether certain words would be used during a Palantir Technologies Inc. earnings call, whether Elon Musk would win his court case against OpenAI and whether the highest temperature in Seattle on Feb. 4 would be within a certain range. Polymarket users have bet on whether the US would strike Iran on a particular date, whether a given Trump cabinet member would be the first to leave office and whether Jesus Christ would return before 2027. Bloomberg Businessweek Contributor Chris Beam joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.

headline: Palantir (PLTR) Balances Growth Deals with Investor Doubts
summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is one of Goldman Sachs’s top growth stock picks. On February 18, Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) named Rackspace Technology its dedicated data migration and global implementation partner for its two flagship platforms, Foundry and Artificial Intelligence Platform, or AIP. Foundry facilitates enterprise data integration and analytics, and AIP operationalizes AI in […]

headline: Palantir Move To Miami Tests Governance Concerns And Growth Expectations
summary: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) is relocating its headquarters from Denver to Miami, signaling a major shift in its corporate base. The company faces corporate governance concerns after scrutiny of CEO Alex Karp’s high private jet reimbursements. Palantir is under public sector scrutiny as it pursues new government healthcare contracts and a lawsuit against a Swiss magazine. At the same time, Palantir is expanding global partnerships, including work with Rackspace and Innodata to...

headline: Exclusive: SolveAI, at eight months old, raises $50 million to take on the AI coding tool race
summary: Steve Basher’s startup wants his AI to generate software that mimics what an enterprise’s own engineers would have written.
